title: Cheatsheet
text: package comes pre-installed GVSU Posit Workbench. need load package access functions. Note: Software Investigation starter program always include code chunk loads gvsu215 package includes functions need STA215.
code: library(gvsu215)

title: Cheatsheet
text: package’s functions can broken general categories: utilities, tables, plots, inference. templates broken GVSU’s STA 215 textbook chapter include generic example template. evaluate, simply copy code chunk (click copy icon appears hover mouse code chunk), double click “filler code” (text capital letters surrounded underscores, _EXAMPLE_) replace respective code.

title: Cheatsheet
text: read data files, need know file path file. use Note: Software Investigation starter program include code read data.
code: _DATANAME_ <- read.csv("_FILEPATH_", header = TRUE)

title: Cheatsheet
code: _NEWDATANAME_ <- _OLDDATANAME_ %>%    filter(_CONDITION_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: _NEWDATANAME_ <- _OLDDATANAME_ %>%    select(_VARSTOKEEP_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_1var(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Change na_rm = TRUE eliminate missing values plot.
code: plot_bar(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, type = "percent", na_rm = FALSE)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Change na_rm = TRUE eliminate missing values plot.
code: plot_bar(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, type = "count", na_rm = FALSE)

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_2var(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: plot_bar(_DATANAME_, ~_RESPONSE_, fill = ~_EXPLANATORY_, na_rm = FALSE)

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_num_sum(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, na_rm = TRUE)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Replace percentiles values want separated commas. example, c(0.80, 0.90, 0.95)
code: tbl_pctile(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, probs = c(_PERCENTILES_))

title: Cheatsheet
code: plot_box(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: can use breaks control many bars .
code: plot_hist(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_num_sum(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_, na_rm = TRUE)

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_pctile(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: plot_box(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: can use breaks control many bars .
code: plot_hist(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, group = ~_GROUPVARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Confidence levels default 95% can overridden conf_lvl = _DECIMAL_ (e.g., conf_lvl = 0.9).

title: Cheatsheet
code: infer_1prop_int(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, success = "_SUCCESSCATEGORY_", conf_lvl = _CONFIDENCELEVEL_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: infer_1mean_int(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, conf_lvl = _CONFIDENCELEVEL_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Change axis_lines = "" grid scatterplot. Note: Change ls_line = "show" plot regression line.
code: plot_scatter(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_, axis_lines = "none", ls_line = "hide")

title: Cheatsheet
code: tbl_corr(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_, na_rm = TRUE)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Change reduced = "" get test statistic p-value.
code: infer_reg(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_, reduced = "yes")

title: Cheatsheet
code: plot_scatter(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_, fill = ~_GROUPVARIABLE_, legend_title = "_LEGEND_")

title: Cheatsheet
code: # standard test infer_chisq(_DATANAME_, _EXPLANATORY_~_RESPONSE_, type = "test") # expected counts infer_chisq(_DATANAME_, _EXPLANATORY_~_RESPONSE_, type = "expected") # observed counts infer_chisq(_DATANAME_, _EXPLANATORY_~_RESPONSE_, type = "observed")

what: Confidence Interval for the Difference in Two Proportions
title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Confidence levels default 95% can overridden conf_lvl = _DECIMAL_ (e.g., conf_lvl = 0.90). Note: code work explanatory variable must two categories.
code: infer_2prop_int(_DATANAME_, _RESPONSE_~_EXPLANATORY_, success = "_SUCCESSCATEGORY_", conf_lvl = _CONFIDENCELEVEL_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Note: Confidence levels default 95% can overridden conf_lvl = _DECIMAL_ (e.g., conf_lvl = 0.90). Use mu0 argument specify value null hypothesis, different 0. E.g., mu0 = 3.
code: infer_paired(_DATANAME_, var1 = ~_VARIABLE1_, var2 = ~_VARIABLE2_, conf_lvl = _CONFIDENCELEVEL_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Use null argument specify value null hypothesis, different 0. E.g., null = 3.
code: infer_2mean_test(_DATANAME_, _VARIABLE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: infer_2mean_int(_DATANAME_, _VARIABLE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_, conf_lvl = _CONFIDENCELEVEL_)

title: Cheatsheet
code: infer_anova(_DATANAME_, _VARIABLE_~_GROUPVARIABLE_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Use p0 argument specify value null hypothesis, different 0.5. E.g., p0 = 0.3.
code: infer_1prop_test(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, success = "_SUCCESSCATEGORY_", p0 = _NULL_)

title: Cheatsheet
text: Use mu0 argument specify value null hypothesis, different 0. E.g., p0 = 3.
code: infer_1mean_test(_DATANAME_, ~_VARIABLE_, mu0 = _NULL_)

title: Extending the Default Behavior
text: package able used output format using R Markdown, including HTML1, PDF, Word. case, reach Dr. John Gabrosek submit issue GitHub. using PDF output, want make sure student R Markdown files following YAML header allow compiler use xelatex engine. , avoid messages printing every function call able see special characters x‾\bar{x}. exporting Word documents, recommended name variables wisely (.e., short understandable). Sometimes, line breaks table headers can little funky Word documents. static headers forced line breaks break words; however, variable names long many columns table, table appear squished might add line breaks places ideal. may also wish force page break table, can done piping table code flextable::paginate() function.
code: output:   pdf_document:     latex_engine: xelatex

title: Extending the Default Behavior
text: Many functions package extra arguments aren’t necessary basic function features can allow little customization depending pedagogical approach preferences, focusing data literacy proper axis labeling. functions listed extra arguments, detailed function name. digits argument can specified integer value number digits round . Defaults 3. caption argument can used override default caption. with_prop argument (defaults “”) can set “yes” replace percent column corresponding proportions. na_rm argument can used remove missing values table (note functions remove missing values default) row_pct argument can used add row percentages cell. digits argument can specified integer value number digits round . Defaults 3. caption argument can used override default caption. na_rm argument can used remove missing values table (note missing values removed default) probs argument can used specify percentiles given. Simply pass vector values 0 1. digits argument can specified integer value number digits round . Defaults 3. caption argument can used override default caption. type argument can used specify plot percents counts desired. fill argument can used choose fill color (single variable plot). layout argument can used swap side--side (sbs, default) stacked bar plots (stack). orient argument can used flip axis. Choose either “vertical” (default) “horizontal”. dodge argument can used create rows x-axis labels. can help labels overlapping. Use integer tell many row create (2 recommended interpretability). title argument can used override default title. ... used labels plot, namely, x- y-axis labels. fill argument can used choose fill color. breaks argument can used specify x-axis breaks. Use seq(start, stop, jump). orient argument can used flip axis. Choose either “vertical” (default) “horizontal”. title argument can used override default title. ... used labels plot, namely, x- y-axis labels. group_cols argument can used grouped histogram specify many columns faceted output take . fill argument can used choose fill color. breaks can used specify x-axis labels broken. Use seq(_START_, _STOP_, _JUMP_). Accuracy guaranteed. title argument can used override default title. ... used labels plot, namely, x- y-axis labels. fill argument can used choose fill color (non-grouped plot). title argument can used override default title. legend_title argument can used override default legend title. axis_lines argument can used draw axis gridlines plot (). ls_line argument can set TRUE draw least squares line. ... used labels plot, namely, x- y-axis labels. digits argument can specified integer value number digits round . Defaults 3. caption argument can used override default caption. conf_lvl argument can used choose different confidence level 0.95. (applicable infer_anova().) mu0 argument can used specify null hypothesis value, different 0. p0 argument can used specify null hypothesis value, different 0.5. extra function interested. appear student cheatsheet.

what: Pretty Plots and Charts for Introductory Statistical Concepts
title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Introductory Statistical Concepts
text: Pretty Plots Charts Introductory Statistical Concepts Note: Due fact functions return tables (essentially HTML code), README GitHub display properly. result, output image resulting table rather actual HTML table. images include table caption time. gvsu215 contains series wrapper functions around select mosaic ggformula functions, help flextable ggplot2. goal provide introductory statistics students/learners easy way generate nice-looking plots tables without focusing code used create . tables plots generated package doctored themes pre-applied. , output print “messy” format R console can used interactively, including R Markdown documents. package designed tailored Grand Valley State University (course code: STA 215) can used anyone.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Introductory Statistical Concepts
text: package CRAN. can install development version gvsu215 GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ian-curtis/gvsu215")

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Introductory Statistical Concepts
text: order use package, need basic understanding R syntax run function preferred working environment. Functions use formula syntax (e.g., var1 ~ var2) thus knowledge formulas needed well.

title: Pretty Plots and Charts for Introductory Statistical Concepts
text: package best used creating simple plots charts extensive customization necessary. instance, may just want see summary statistics, including one- two-way tables.   maybe just need percentiles:  also support variety plots…    … statistical inference.
code: library(gvsu215) tbl_2var(mtcars, gear~cyl) tbl_num_sum(mtcars, ~wt, na_rm = TRUE) tbl_pctile(mtcars, ~wt, probs = c(0, .25, .4, .5, .6, .75, 1)) plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "percent") plot_box(mtcars,           wt~gear,           fill = 'orangered4',           x = "Gear",           y = "Weight",           title = "Boxplot of Weight by Gear") plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat) #> NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots. infer_1prop(mtcars, ~vs, success = 1) infer_paired(mtcars, var1 = ~drat, var2 = ~wt) infer_2mean_int(mtcars, wt~vs) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear)) suppressWarnings(infer_chisq(mtcars, cyl~gear, type = "expected")) infer_anova(mtcars, cyl~gear, digits = 2)

what: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
title: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: Used internally detect user inputted confidence level correctly (.e., quotes decimal).

title: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
code: check_conf_lvl(level)

title: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: level confidence level question

title: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
text: Nothing, error message.

title: INTERNAL: Check if a confidence level is entered in decimal form — check_conf_lvl
code: check_conf_lvl(.95) try(check_conf_lvl("95%")) #> Error in check_conf_lvl("95%") :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive #> (not in quotes). try(check_conf_lvl(95)) #> Error in check_conf_lvl(95) :  #>   Confidence level should be given as a decimal between 0 and 1, inclusive #> (not in quotes).

what: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
title: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Used internally check error might occur later. catch error provide helpful message users based common causes errors.

title: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: check_test(code)

title: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: code code try run

title: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
text: Nothing, may print error message.

title: INTERNAL: Check if an error will occur later — check_test
code: library(stats)  check_test(head(mtcars)) #>                    mpg cyl disp  hp drat    wt  qsec vs am gear carb #> Mazda RX4         21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.620 16.46  0  1    4    4 #> Mazda RX4 Wag     21.0   6  160 110 3.90 2.875 17.02  0  1    4    4 #> Datsun 710        22.8   4  108  93 3.85 2.320 18.61  1  1    4    1 #> Hornet 4 Drive    21.4   6  258 110 3.08 3.215 19.44  1  0    3    1 #> Hornet Sportabout 18.7   8  360 175 3.15 3.440 17.02  0  0    3    2 #> Valiant           18.1   6  225 105 2.76 3.460 20.22  1  0    3    1 try(check_test(head(Mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or #> a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.  check_test(lm(wt~drat, data = mtcars)) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = wt ~ drat, data = mtcars) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)         drat   #>       7.906       -1.304   #>  try(check_test(lm(Wt~drat, data = mtcars))) #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Could not complete the process. Perhaps you spelled the dataset name or #> a variable name wrong? Hint: R is case-sensitive.

text: infer_2prop() alternative infer_2prop_test() infer_2prop_int(). title: All-in-one alternate two-sample proportion test — infer_2prop
code: infer_2prop(   data,   formula,   success,   digits = 3,   conf_lvl = 0.95,   conf_int = c("hide", "show"),   caption = NULL )

title: All-in-one alternate two-sample proportion test — infer_2prop
text: data data frame (tibble). formula variables run test , formula syntax, var1 ~ var2. success data value constitutes "success". digits number digits round table values . Defaults 3. conf_lvl confidence level interval, entered value 0 1. Defaults 0.95. conf_int confidence interval provided addition hypothesis test output? Defaults "hide" option "show". caption override table caption. sensible default provided.

title: Create a summary table for a chi-squared test — infer_chisq
text: infer_chisq() creates tidy summary table results chi-squared test. Alternatively, can select see expected counts (type = "expected") observed counts (type = "observed").

title: Create a summary table for a chi-squared test — infer_chisq
code: infer_chisq(   data,   formula,   type = c("test", "expected", "observed"),   digits = 3,   caption = NULL )

title: Create a summary table for a chi-squared test — infer_chisq
text: data data frame (tibble). formula variable run test , formula syntax, ~var. type kind output receive. Valid options either "test" (default), "expected", "observed". digits number digits round table values . Defaults 3. caption override table caption. sensible default provided.

title: Create a summary table for a chi-squared test — infer_chisq
text: object class flextable.

what: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: Create simple bar plot

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
code: plot_bar(   data,   formula,   type = c("percent", "count"),   fill = "#0032A0",   layout = c("sbs", "stack"),   orient = c("vertical", "horizontal"),   dodge = 1,   title = NULL,   subtitle = c("show", "hide"),   na_rm = TRUE,   ... )

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: data data frame. formula variable tabulate. given formula notation, ~var. type type plot create. Valid options "percent" (default) "count". fill fill plot. Valid options character color (one variable plots) variable given formula notation (~var), used create grouped bar plot. layout bar type grouped plots. Either "sbs" side--side bars "stack" stacked bars. fill must variable go effect. orient orientation plot (either "vertical", default, "horizontal"). shortcut, "v" "h" may used. dodge number rows dodge axis labels , overlapping. title override title plot. sensible default provided. subtitle switch hiding default subtitle. One "show" "hide". na_rm missing values removed? Defaults TRUE. ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
text: ggplot object. interactive session, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple bar plot — plot_bar
code: plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "count")  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "percent", fill = "yellowgreen") #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, orient = "horizontal") #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.  plot_bar(dplyr::starwars, ~hair_color, dodge = 2) #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, subtitle = "hide") #> Scale for y is already present. #> Adding another scale for y, which will replace the existing scale.   plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, fill = ~gear)  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, fill = ~gear, layout = "stack")  plot_bar(mtcars, ~cyl, type = "count", fill = ~gear)

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: plot_box() builds simple, pre-themed boxplot one variable alone grouped another variable.

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
code: plot_box(   data,   formula,   fill = "grey80",   breaks = NULL,   orient = c("vertical", "horizontal"),   title = NULL,   subtitle = c("show", "hide"),   ... )

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: data data frame. formula Variables entered formula notation. Either ~var one-variable boxplot var1~var2 grouped boxplot var2 grouping variable. fill fill color boxplot. Entered character. breaks vector length 3 (start, stop, step) specifying x-scale broken . orient orientation plot (either "vertical", default, "horizontal"). shortcut, "v" "h" may used. title override title plot. sensible default provided. subtitle switch hiding default subtitle. One "show" "hide". ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
text: ggplot object. interactive environment, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple boxplot — plot_box
code: plot_box(mtcars, ~wt) #> Note: NAs always removed for boxplots #> This message is displayed once per session.  plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear, fill = 'orangered4')  plot_box(mtcars, ~wt, breaks = seq(1, 6, 0.5))  plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear)  plot_box(mtcars, wt~gear, breaks = seq(1, 6, 0.5))

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: plot_hist() builds histogram one variable alone grouped single, categorical grouping variable. number grouped plot columns can adjusted based levels grouping variable. Default histograms likely show data best way (function warn per session). remedy , use breaks argument. values given vector numbers. first number minimum value want displayed, second maximum value display, third "step" distance.

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: data data frame. formula variable tabulate. given formula notation, ~var. fill fill color bins, entered character. breaks use seq function (start, stop, step) specifying x-scale broken . good default provided based range values data. group grouping (faceting) variable entered formula syntax, ~group_var. group_cols number columns make grouped (faceted) plot. Defaults 1 (stacked vertical plots). title override title plot. sensible default provided. subtitle switch hiding default subtitle. One "show" "hide". ... Extra title arguments passed ggformula::gf_labs() (feeds ggplot2::ggplot()).

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
text: ggplot object. interactive environment, results viewable immediately.

title: Create a simple histogram — plot_hist
code: plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat) #> ! No value for breaks supplied. Your histogram may not show your data accurately. #> Note: NAs always removed for histograms #> This message is displayed once per session.  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, breaks = seq(3, 6, 0.5))  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, breaks = seq(1, 6, 0.5), fill = "red")   plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, group = ~cyl, breaks = seq(2, 5, 0.25))  plot_hist(mtcars, ~drat, group = ~cyl, breaks = seq(2, 5, 0.25), group_cols = 2)

code: plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat) #> Note: NAs always removed (in pairs) for scatterplots. #> This message is displayed once every 8 hours.  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = "red")  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, axis_lines = "both")  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, ls_line = "show")   plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = ~cyl)  plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = ~cyl, ls_line = "show") plot_scatter(mtcars, wt~drat, fill = ~cyl, legend_title = "Cylinders")

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: tbl_pctile() wrapper around mosaic::quantile() creates tidy table data values given percentiles.

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
code: tbl_pctile(   data,   formula,   digits = 3,   probs = c(0, 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1),   caption = NULL )

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: data data frame (tibble). formula Variables summarize given formula notation: ~var1 var1~var2. var1 numeric var2, supplied, grouping variable. digits number digits round . Defaults 3. probs vector percentiles compute. value must 0 1, inclusive. Defaults 0, 25%, 50%, 75%, 100%. caption override table caption. sensible default given.

title: Create percentile summaries — tbl_pctile
text: object class flextable. interactive session, table viewable immediately.

title: gvsu215 0.6.2
text: Corrected error plot_bar() stacked bar chart requested. Bar section heights now match actual proportion respective values. Two-sample tests intervals now merged, centered, grey cells differentiate group statistics. Flip-flopped variable names titles stacked bar charts read *fill variable* *x-axis variable*.

title: gvsu215 0.6.1
text: Adjusted captions infer_mean_* infer_prop_*. intervals showing confidence levels tests . back regular places. infer_2mean_test() now mu0 argument used difference means equal 0.

title: gvsu215 0.6.0
text: plot_bar() now includes ability specify stacked bar chart. fill must variable, use layout argument set stack. (sbs, side--side, default). Various small fixes documentation vignettes

title: gvsu215 0.5.5
text: functions na_rm argument now default TRUE (rather FALSE) KNOWN ISSUE: Table captions pdf output wonky spacing. believed bug within flextable progress.

title: gvsu215 0.5.4
text: Line breaks table headers now forced \n, users need specify line breaks variable names Max width tables non-interactive non-HTML output (e.g., PDF Word) 6.9 inches. max width given outputs. Note added extending default behavior article. spacing clusters grouped bar chart (plot_bar() used fill argument set variable) increased. done decreasing width actual bars categories x-axis variable might cause spacing decrease.

title: gvsu215 0.5.3
text: Revert / clarify p-values tests mean proportion two-tailed

title: gvsu215 0.5.2
text: Various calculation corrections. Mostly functions dealing proportion inference regarding standard error confidence intervals. P-values now show one-tailed

title: gvsu215 0.5.1
text: mu0 means p0 proportions

title: gvsu215 0.5.0
text: axes tbl_2var() flipped flipped back right way (way ). inference functions deal means new argument: null , default, set zero. Use argument Corrections cheatsheet extending behavior articles.

title: gvsu215 0.4.7
text: can now see proportions tbl_1var() addition percents. Use with_prop = "yes". Ever wanted make missing values disappear one-way two-way tables? Now can! tbl_1var() tbl_2var() support na_rm argument. axes tbl_2var() flipped flipped back right way. infer_1prop() now infer_1prop_int() infer_1mean() now infer_1mean_int() NEW: infer_1prop_test() NEW: infer_1mean_test() plot_box() now breaks argument (works just like plot_hist()). plot also little smarter adding extra padding around min max plot.

title: gvsu215 0.4.6
text: new argument given plot_bar(): orient, can take either “vertical” “horizontal” can used flip axes plot. plot_bar() plot_box() new argument: dodge take integer greater 0 (default 1) dodge x-axis labels overlap. plot_hist() now work groups. Oops!

title: gvsu215 0.4.5
text: student cheatsheet updated. Functions don’t na_rm argument longer show option. Instructor’s Guide renamed accurately describe ’s content. Histograms now default showing non-overlapping x-axis values, necessary. infer_chisq now removes NAs automatically. Output now shows many observations originally well many used output.

title: gvsu215 0.4.4
text: tbl_num_sum() output: missing values removed (.e., na_rm = TRUE) number missing values still shown table. Previously column removed still good information show.

title: gvsu215 0.4.3
text: Appearance changes tables (font size borders) Correct error previous release function dplyr::na_if() used without :: syntax.

title: gvsu215 0.4.2
text: now can use base::read.csv() functions! unique case presented missing value recorded “” (empty string) detected default `read.csv(). functions now search character variables empty strings replace true NAs. expanded future.

title: gvsu215 0.4.1
text: tables properly right-aligned Cosmetic changes multiple plots tables Add padding zeroes case rounded number shorter number digits supplied Clarification updates captions/titles plot_bar tbl_pctile

title: gvsu215 0.4.0
text: arguments previously took either TRUE FALSE value converted vector-style arguments. example plot_scatter(), ls_line argument now accepts either “show” “hide”. exception na_rm, wherever appears. Error warning messages updated. now slightly user-friendly thanks cli rlang packages. comments added source code help remember six months now.

title: gvsu215 0.3.8
text: Corrected error infer_paired() incorrect use :: syntax Updated figures displayed README (now accurately show right alignment table body cells)

title: gvsu215 0.3.7
text: Values tables now rounded standard “nearest digit” format numbers -1 1. Numbers -1 1 rounded using significant digits (.e., non-zero digits decimal) use digits argument standard rounding. p-value rounding adjusted. p-value less 0.0001 now display “< 0.0001”. values display true value follow rounding rules mentioned .

title: gvsu215 0.3.6
text: plot_hist(): binwidth argument deprecated longer available. Instead, use breaks , used, helps line bins x-axis ticks better readability interpretation. student cheatsheet slightly reworked line textbook chapters.

title: gvsu215 0.3.5
text: tbl_num_sum() now shows number NAs caption na_rm TRUE show “missing” column (0s case). funciont also now correctly display “NAs Removed” caption. Default table output width now 6 inches avoid bleeding margins PDF Word documents.

title: gvsu215 0.3.4
text: Package now depends ggformula (rather imports) help avoid potential namespace issue users loaded ggformula. Small adjustments plot themes output infer_chisq(., type = "expected") now shows variable names table.

title: gvsu215 0.3.3
text: Small documentation updates Reworked -function variable names Updated internal tests Redesigned student cheatsheet, built instructor’s guide

title: gvsu215 0.3.2
text: Updated documentation (including add least squares line plot_scatter()). Tried change legend title grouped scatterplot didn’t work? Now ! new vignette appeared! contains code shell/template functions package. ---box use, simply copy code fill blanks. error messages show less frequently.

title: gvsu215 0.3.1
text: plot_bar() now show colors correctly type = "count" specified. tbl_num_sum() longer show NAs NAs present na_rm = FALSE given. second variable entered infer_anova() now coerced factor degrees freedom correctly calculated.

title: gvsu215 0.3.1
text: now may use infer_2mean() infer_2prop() perform two-sample proportion mean test, respectively. main perk conf_int argument. specified TRUE, confidence interval given addition hypothesis test output. functions provided alternative infer_2prop_int(), infer_2prop_test(), infer_2mean_int(), infer_2mean_test(). Rather two functions intervals tests, can now one function choose.

title: gvsu215 0.3.0
text: tbl_one() –> tbl_1var() tbl_two() –> tbl_2var() num_sum() –> tbl_num_sum() pctile() –> tbl_pctile() corr() –> tbl_corr() infer_mean1() –> infer_1mean() infer_mean2() –> infer_2mean() infer_prop1() –> infer_1prop() infer_mean2_int() –> infer_2mean_int() infer_mean2_test() –> infer_2mean_test() infer_prop2_int() –> infer_2prop_int() infer_prop2_test() –> infer_2prop_test()

title: gvsu215 0.3.0
text: package vignette (README) changed import images tables. HTML output code work well GitHub tables don’t appear .

title: gvsu215 0.2.0
text: Two functions renamed. one_way() now tbl_one() two_way() now tbl_two(). old functions available. plot_scatter(): default value legend_title now NULL (supplied variable name). can still supply new string legend title.

title: gvsu215 0.2.0
text: two_way() (tbl_two()) output cleaned plot_box() plot_hist() now scientific notation certain ranges numbers corr() now shows observations used (since always just sum n1 n2 missing) added confidence interval infer_paired() two-sample family functions now show correct levels grouping variable respective calculations .

title: gvsu215 0.1.1
text: general fixes output layout theme, especially two_way() rounding corrections plot_scatter() now allows least squares line drawn bug fix num_sum()

title: gvsu215 0.1.0
text: package functions now usable functions documented functions tests
